Questions.QuestionString: The thrust setting parameter is: (level 2)
Answers: Engine Pressure Ratio in normal mode
EPR in normal mode, N1 in degraded mode.

Questions.QuestionString: The thrust reverser actuators are synchronized: (level 2)
The active clearance control (ACC) system ensures: (level 2)
Which engine parameters are displayed on the upper ECAM? (level 2)
Answers: EPR, N1, N2, oil pressure, oil temperature

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the master chip detector located: (level 2)
Answers: In the No. 4 bearing compartment scavange line
In the combined oil scavange return line
In the forward bearing compartment scavange line

Questions.QuestionString: The HPC consists of: (level 2)
The FADEC system consists of: (level 2)
Answers: A single EEC with its peripherals for both engines
A single EEC with its peripherals per engine
One main frame computer for all engines

Questions.QuestionString: The function of the deactivation lever located on the HCU is to: (level 2)
The aerodynamic station # 3 is located at the: (level 2)
Where does the TH/R hydraulic SOV locate? (level 2)
The ignition system uses: (level 2)
For calculating vibrations,  the EVMU receives signals from: (level 2)
Answers: The 2 engine accelerometers (1 per engine) and the N1 and N2 of each engine
the 2 engine accelerometers (1 per engine) and the N1 of each engine
the 2 engine accelerometers (1 per engine) and the N2 of each engine

Questions.QuestionString: In which conditions the engine oil passes through ACOC: (level 2)
Answers: It depends on oil temperature logic computed in EEC
It depends on fuel temperature logic computed in EEC

Questions.QuestionString: The EEC controls the HMS via: (level 2)
Which statement below is correct? (level 2)
Answers: The starter accelerates the spool N2 through geaboxes whenever starter valve opens and air is supplied
The starter accelerates the spool N1 through geaboxes whenever starter valve opens and air is supplied
The starter is disengaged from the gearbox when engine is running

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement below is correct? (level 3)
Answers: The 4 handling bleed valves are actuated by servo fuel.
The 4 handling bleed valves have no feed-back position to EEC.
The 4 handling bleed valves are controlled by EIU.

Questions.QuestionString: “V2530-A5” means: (level 3)
Answers: engine is rated at max thrust of 25300 lbs to install in the Airbus A/
engine is rated at max thrust of 30000 lbs to install in the Airbus A/
engine is rated at max thrust of 25000 lbs to install in the Airbus A/

Questions.QuestionString: How many blades in one engine fan set; (level 1)
Which bearings is the HP rotor supported by: (level 1)
Which bearings is the LP rotor supported by: (level 1)
Aerodynamic station 4.9 means: (level 1)
Aerodynamic station 2.5 means: (level 1)
What is the engine pressure ratio (EPR): (level 1)
How is the HP fuel system protected against excessive pressure: (level 1)
Answers: by a relief valve venting excess pump delivery pressure to the pump inlet
by a relief valve in the FMU venting excess pressure to the diverter valve
by a by pass valve opening in the LP filter

Questions.QuestionString: How many modes does the HMS (Heat Management System) have: (level 1)
Choose the most correct statement: (level 1)
Answers: the purpose of the HMS is to maintain engine fuel temperature, engine oil temperature and IDG oil temperature within limits
the purpose of the HMS is to maintain engine fuel temperature and engine oil temperature within limits
the purpose of the HMS is to maintain engine oil temperature and IDG oil temperature within limits

Questions.QuestionString: Choose the correct statement: (level 1)
Answers: the ACOC valve regulates the engine oil flowing through the ACOC
the ACOC valve regulates the flow of fan air crossing the ACOC
the ACOC valve regulates the flow of ram air crossing the ACOC

Questions.QuestionString: Is the fuel diverter valve a modulating valve: (level 1)
Is the fuel to tank flow modulating: (level 1)
When does the dedicated generator (PMA) supply the EEC: (level 1)
Answers: only if the A/C electrical power fails

Questions.QuestionString: What happens in case of failure of the EIU: (level 2)
Answers: the engine goes to flight idle mode

Questions.QuestionString: How does the engine starter operate: (level 2)
In which case can the EEC abort the start: (level 1)
What causes an automatic continuous relight selection (level 1)
How many bleed valves are there to control the HPC airflow: (level 1)
Answers: three 10th stage valves and one 7th stage valve
three 7th stage valves and one 10th stage valve
one 10th stage valves and one 7th stage valve

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the air taken from to cool #4 bearing compartment: (level 1)
Where are the engine primary parameters permanently displayed: (level 1)
Where are the engine secondary parameters displayed: (level 1)
Where is the T/R Hydraulic Isolation Valve located: (level 1)
Where is the T/R Directional Control Valve located: (level 1)
Answers: in the hydraulic supply between the HCU and the upper actuators

Questions.QuestionString: What senses movement of T/R translating sleeves: (level 1)
Answers: the proximity switches on the locking actuators
the LVDT’s(Linear Variable Differential Transducers) on upper actuators.

Questions.QuestionString: Has the pressure filter a bypass valve fitted in the oil system? (level 2)
What is the purpose of an auto re-stow system if available? (level 1)
Answers: To stow the thrust reverser when the thrust control lever at idle reverse position.

Questions.QuestionString: Approximately at what speed does the starter air valve (SAV) close during a start sequence? (level 1)
What senses movement of the T/R translating sleeve? (level 3)
Answers: The LVDT’s on the upper actuators.
The proximity switches on the locking actuators.
The LVDT’s on the lower actuators.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the servo fuel for the fuel operated actuators supplied from? (level 2)
How many igniter plugs and exciter boxes are fitted in the combustion system? (level 2)
Which area of the inlet cowl has ice protection? (level 3)
Answers: The inlet cowl lip or “D” section
There is no ice protection thanks to aerodynamic design of the engine.
The inner barrel of inlet cowl

Questions.QuestionString: In case of P2/T2 probe heating failure during engine operation, the affected engine will operate in: (level 3)
What is true regarding to the No4 bearing compartment scavenge valve? (level 3)
If EIU fails during the engine operation: (level 3)
Answers: The FADEC increases the power setting.
The dedicated alternator supplies power to FADEC.

Questions.QuestionString: When the engine is operated in thrust reverse mode: (level 3)
Answers: The engine is controlled in EPR mode.
The engine is controlled in N1 mode.
The engine is controlled normally: in EPR mode and in the case of failure: in N1 mode.

Questions.QuestionString: The Engine V2533-A5 can be understood that: (level 3)
Answers: This engine is used on Airbus A/C with maximum thrust 33000lbs.
This engine is used on McDonnell Douglas A/C with maximum thrust 33000lbs.
This engine is used on Airbus A/C with maximum thrust 25000lbs.

Questions.QuestionString: How is the thrust rating defined on the V2500? (level 3)
Answers: By an engine data programming plug.

Questions.QuestionString: For V2500, how many fan blades are there? (level 2)
An oil tank access door is provided for servicing: (level 3)
Answers: On the right side fan cowl door.
On the left side fan cowl door.
On the left side thrust reverser "C" duct door.

Questions.QuestionString: A starter valve access panel is provided for manual operation: (level 3)
Answers: On the right side fan cowl door.
On the left side fan cowl door.
On the right side thrust reverser "C" duct door.

Questions.QuestionString: How to open the thrust reverser "C" duct doors(level 3)
Answers: by an hydraulic actuator using a manual hand pump.
by an hydraulic actuator using a engine hydraulic pump.

Questions.QuestionString: How to open the fan cowl doors(level 3)
Answers: by an hydraulic actuator using a manual hand pump.
by an hydraulic actuator using a engine hydraulic pump.

Questions.QuestionString: For V2500, how is the accessory gearbox driven? (level 3)
Answers: By the HP rotor via the Angle gearbox.
By the LP rotor via the transfer gearbox.

Questions.QuestionString: For V2500, what bearings support the HP rotor? (level 3)
The fluids collected from the V2500 power plant are discharged overboard through: (level 3)
Answers: the drain located at the rear part of pylon.
the engine drains at the bottom of the engine.
the pylon drains and the engine drains.

Questions.QuestionString: For V2500, which fluids can be discharged through the drain? (level 3)
The V2500-A5 engine is made of following modules: (level 3)
Answers: Fan, intermediate case, High Pressure (HP) system, Low Pressure (LP) turbine, accessory drives.
Fan and LP compressor, HP compressor, combustion chamber and HP turbine, LP turbine and turbine rear frame, Transfer and accessory gearboxes.
Fan, intermediate case, High Pressure (HP) system, Low Pressure (LP) turbine, Transfer and accessory gearboxes.

Questions.QuestionString: The V2500 HP (N2) rotor is made of: (level 3)
Answers: 12-stage compressor driven by a 4 stage turbine.
9-stage compressor driven by a single stage turbine.
10-stage HP compressor driven by a 2-stage HP turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: The V2500 LP rotor (N1) is made of: (level 3)
Answers: the fan and the booster compressor driven by the five stage LP turbine.
Four stage compressor driven by a two stage turbine.
fan and a four-stage compressor driven by a four stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: The compressor stage Nº12 is: (level 3)
Answers: The 12th stage of the HP compressor.
The 10th stage of the HP compressor.
The 7th stage of the HP compressor.

Questions.QuestionString: The Engine vibration indications are displayed: (level 3)
Answers: On the ENGINE page and the CRUISE page.

Questions.QuestionString: The FADEC system includes the: (level 3)
Answers: Engine Electronic Controller (EEC) and the Engine Interface Unit (EIU).
EEC and the peripheral sensors and components on the engine.

Questions.QuestionString: The V2500 FADEC system is self-powered by (level 3)
Answers: a dedicated Permanent Magnet Alternator (PMA) when N2 is greater than 10%.
a dedicated permanent magnet alternator when N2 is greater than 12%,
the aircraft for starting, and for testing with engine running.

Questions.QuestionString: The engine Full Authority Digital Engine Control (FADEC) provides (level 3)
Answers: engine control, engine monitoring and help for maintenance and trouble shooting.

Questions.QuestionString: HP/LP turbine blade tip clearance is achieved by: (level 3)
Answers: Directing booster bleed air onto the turbine case.
Directing 7th stage air into the LP turbine blades.
Directing fan air onto the turbine case.

Questions.QuestionString: During manual start, the starter air valve (SAV) is closed: (level 3)
Answers: Manually by selecting “ENG MAN” pushbutton to OFF
Manually by selecting “ENG MASTER” switch to OFF

Questions.QuestionString: The ignition is inhibited during(level 2)
Engine oil parameters are monitored in the(level 2)
What is the cooled HP 12th stage air used for? (level 1)
Answers: Cooling and pressurization of the center bearing compartment (No 4 bearing)
Internal cooling of HPT vanes and disks.

Questions.QuestionString: The high pressure compressor airflow is controlled by the variable stator vanes (VSVs) and: (level 3)
EEC get N2 signal from (level 3)
Answers: N2 sensor fitted on the rear of the main gearbox
N2 sensor fitted on the rear of the angle gearbox
Converting frequency of one of the windings of the PMA

Questions.QuestionString: During thrust reverser operation, EEC controls thrust (level 3)
EEC control thrust of the engine through (level 3)
Answers: N1 as primary, EPR as back-up
EPR as primary, N1 as back-up

Questions.QuestionString: Engine oil is cooled by (level 2)
Answers: FCOC as primary, ACOC as secondary
ACOC as primary, FCOC as secondary
FCOC as primary, ACAC as secondary

Questions.QuestionString: The engine thrust indicated on ECAM via EPR. What is the engine pressure ratio (EPR)? (Level 2)
The airflow control system is a combination of which sub-SYSTEMS? (Level 2)
Answers: Stage 7 and 10 Bleed valves and aircraft service bleed.
BSBV, HPC VSV and stage 7 & 10 Bleed valves.
HPC VSV, BSBV and stages 5 & 8 bleed valves.

Questions.QuestionString: Engine naccelled temperature sensor is? (Level 3)
If starter air valve solenoid is INOPERATIVE? (Level 3)
Answers: You can not start the engine.
You can still start the engine using manual start sequence.
You can only start engine by operating the SAV manually.

Questions.QuestionString: How many vibration sensors are installed on each engine? (Level 3)
Answers: Two, one in bearing N0 1 compartment, one on the Turbine Rear Frame.
One dual sensor on the intermediate case.
One sensor on the fan case

Questions.QuestionString: What is (are) the indications in case of metallic parts in the common scavenge oil pipe? (Level 2)
Answers: Only a popped clogging indication on the electrical chip detector indicator.
An ECAM warning and a popped clogging indication on the electrical chip detector indicator.

Questions.QuestionString: BSBV Acuator operates by: (Level 1)
P3 is pressure of the air come from? (Level 1)
What controls the adequate cooling of the engine and IDG oils? (Level 1)
Answers: The Fuel Diverter and Return Valve

Questions.QuestionString: THE FANCOWL DOOR IS HELD IN POSITION BY: (Level 1)
DURING ENGINE START IN MANUAL MODE, IGNITION SYSTEMS A AND B ARE SHOWN ON ECAM: (Level 3)
Answers: It means that either system A or B has failed
It means that both systems A and B failed
This is normal. A and B are selected in manual start

Questions.QuestionString: HOW DOES THE STARTER OPERATE ? (Level 1)
THE AERODYNAMIC STATION No. 4 IS LOCATED AT THE : (Level 2)
WHICH STATEMENT IS CORRECT ? (Level 2)
Answers: The starter  accelerates N1 spool through the gearbox
The starter accelerates  N2 spool through  the gearbox
The starter  accelerates N1 and N2 spool through the gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: What does the Heat Management System heat and cool? (Level 2)
Answers: Fuel, engine oil and IDG oil

Questions.QuestionString: The ACOC: (Level 2)
Answers: Uses RAM air to remove heat from the engine oil
Uses FAN air for additional cooling the engine oil
Cools the engine oil downstream of the FCOC

Questions.QuestionString: The thrust setting parameter is : (Level 2)
Answers: Engine Pressure Ratio in normal mode

Questions.QuestionString: What is the logic of the reverse operation? (Level 3)
Answers: TLA position and aircraft on ground only.
TLA position, aircraft on ground and Reverse indication green.
TLA position, aircraft on ground, engine running (N2 condition) and both SECs and EIU signals

Questions.QuestionString: The thrust controlled during thrust reverser operation is: (Level 3)
When the throttle lever is between two detents , the thrust rating limit corresponds to : (Level 2)
Features of V2530-A5 engine are: (Level 2)
Answers: Two spools, axial flow, annular combustor and mixed exhaust.
Two spools, radial flow, annular combustor and mixed exhaust.
Two spools, axial flow, annular combustor and separated exhaust.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is electrical power for P2/T2 probe heating comes from? (Level 2)
Which engine parameters are displayed on the ECAM upper display? (Level 2)
Answers: N1, N2, EPR, oil pressure, oil temperature.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the ACOC valve regulate? (Level 3)
Answers: The engine oil flowing through the ACOC.
The flow of fan air crossing the ACOC.
The flow of ram air crossing the ACOC.
